item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 27, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. You're probably not vulnerable to the CUPS CVE (24 points | 5 comments)
2. It's hard to write code for computers, but it's harder to write code for humans (14 points | discuss)
3. Legalizing Sports Gambling Was a Mistake (491 points | 479 comments)
4. End of an era: Landsat 7 mission takes final images (217 points | 38 comments)
5. I Am Tired of AI (291 points | 311 comments)
6. Small3dlib: Suckless PD 3D software rasterizer (188 points | 54 comments)
7. I have 2000 old VHS tapes in my garage and don't know what to do with them (247 points | 205 comments)
8. Hacking Kia: Remotely controlling cars with just a license plate (456 points | 285 comments)
9. Two kinds of LLM responses: Informational vs. Instructional (31 points | 5 comments)
10. Vanilla OS 2: an immutable distribution to run all software (110 points | 33 comments)
11. A pilot project in universal algebra to explore new ways to collaborate (154 points | 15 comments)
12. Why are my ZFS disks so noisy? (101 points | 21 comments)
13. Leak claims RTX 5090 has 600W TGP, RTX 5080 hits 400W (9 points | discuss)
14. Imbue (YC S17) Is Hiring a Founding Product Engineer ( | hide)
15. FCC unlocks spectrum to support advanced satellite services (113 points | 55 comments)
16. NKRYPT Sculpture (232 points | 8 comments)
17. Sony, Ubisoft scandals lead to California ban on deceptive digital goods sales (184 points | 47 comments)
18. BookStack: Simple and Free Wiki Software (48 points | 8 comments)
19. Microsoft's new Outlook client moves your email to the cloud (130 points | 95 comments)
20. Why did reporters for years end their stories by writing "-30-"? (2007) (11 points | 6 comments)
21. Smart TVs take snapshots of what you watch multiple times per second (76 points | 50 comments)
22. Implementing and Detecting Anti-Debugging with Fork() (26 points | 8 comments)
23. I've tracked every piece of clothing I've worn for three years (2021) (104 points | 144 comments)
24. The ambition of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 (117 points | 86 comments)
25. Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS (359 points | 268 comments)
26. Stem cells reverse woman’s diabetes (230 points | 33 comments)
27. Dethrace: Reverse engineering the 1997 game "Carmageddon" (2023) (77 points | 22 comments)
28. Nardwuar on his best and worst interviews (102 points | 30 comments)
29. Malicious SHA-1 (2014) (58 points | 8 comments)
30. Tcl 9.0 (347 points | 174 comments)
